member.name: T:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache
member.summary: An implementation of that acts on behalf of another one, but a (controllable) little chaos in-between.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Distributed.IDistributedCache)
member.summary: The actual used if and when chaos does not happen.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.ChaosThrowProbability
member.summary: A value from 0.0 to 1.0 that represents the probabilty of throwing an exception: set it to 0.0 to never throw or to 1.0 to always throw.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.ChaosMinDelay
member.summary: The minimum amount of randomized delay.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.ChaosMaxDelay
member.summary: The maximum amount of randomized delay.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.SetNeverThrow
member.summary: Force chaos exceptions to never be thrown.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.SetAlwaysThrow
member.summary: Force chaos exceptions to always be thrown.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.SetNeverDelay
member.summary: Force chaos delays to never happen.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.SetAlwaysDelayExactly(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Force chaos delays to always be of exactly this amount.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.SetNeverChaos
member.summary: Force chaos exceptions and delays to never happen.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosDistributedCache.SetAlwaysChaos(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Force chaos exceptions to always throw, and chaos delays to always be of exactly this amount.

member.name: T:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a method call should fail because of a randomized chaos event.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Chaos.ChaosException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntry`1.#ctor(`0,System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Memory.CacheItemPriority,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: The actual value.
THe logical expiration of the cache entry: this is used in when the actual expiration in the cache is higher because of fail-safe.
The of the entry (mainly used in the memory cache).
Indicates if the cache entry comes from a fail-safe activation, so if the value was used as a fallback because errors occurred.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntry`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntry`1.Value
member.summary: The value to be cached.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntry`1.LogicalExpiration
member.summary:
The intended expiration of the entry as requested from the caller
When fail-safe is enabled the entry is cached with a higher duration () so it may be used as a fallback value in case of problems: when that happens, the LogicalExpiration is used to check if the value is stale, instead of losing it by simply let it expire in the cache.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntry`1.Priority
member.summary: The of the entry (mainly used in the memory cache).

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntry`1.IsFromFailSafe
member.summary: Indicates if the cache entry comes from a fail-safe activation, so if the value was used as a fallback because errors occurred.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntry`1.IsLogicallyExpired
member.summary: Checks if the entry is logically expired.
member.returns: A indicating the logical expiration status.

member.summary: Represents all the options available for a single entry.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a object.
member.param: The value for the property. If null, will be used.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.Duration
member.summary: The amount of time after which a cache entry is considered expired.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.LockTimeout
member.summary: The timeout to apply when trying to acquire a lock during a factory execution.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.JitterMaxDuration
member.summary: The maximum amount of extra duration to add to the normal to allow for more variable expirations.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.Size
member.summary: The size of the cache entry (typically used as a value of ).

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.Priority
member.summary: The of the entry in the memory cache.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.MemoryOptionsModifier
member.summary: A function to apply when creating a object from this object, to allow for extra customizations.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.DistributedOptionsModifier
member.summary: A function to apply when creating a object from this object, to allow for extra customizations.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.IsFailSafeEnabled
member.summary: Enable the fail-safe mechanism, which will be activated if and when something goes wrong while calling a factory or getting data from a distributed cache.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FailSafeMaxDuration
member.summary:
When fail-safe is enabled an entry will expire normally nonetheless, but it will also be kept around for this (usually long) duration, so it may be used as a fallback value in case of errors.
TL/DR: the maximum amount of time an expired cache entry can still be used in case of problems.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FailSafeThrottleDuration
member.summary:
If fail-safe is enabled, something goes wrong while getting data (from the distributed cache or while calling the factory) and there is an expired entry to be used as a fallback value, the fail-safe mechanism will actually be activated. In that case the fallback value will not only be returned to the caller but also put in the cache for this duration (usually small) to avoid excessive load on the distributed cache and/or the factory getting called continuously.
TL/DR: the amount of time an expired cache entry is temporarily considered non-expired before checking the source (calling the factory) again.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FactorySoftTimeout
member.summary: The maximum execution time allowed for the factory, applied only if fail-safe is enabled and there is a fallback value to return.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.FactoryHardTimeout
member.summary: The maximum execution time allowed for the factory in any case, even if there is not a stale value to fallback to.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.AllowTimedOutFactoryBackgroundCompletion
member.summary: It enables a factory that has hit a synthetic timeout (both soft/hard) to complete in the background and update the cache with the new value.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.DistributedCacheSoftTimeout
member.summary: The maximum execution time allowed for each operation on the distributed cache, applied only if fail-safe is enabled and there is a fallback value to return.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.DistributedCacheHardTimeout
member.summary: The maximum execution time allowed for each operation on the distributed cache in any case, even if there is not a stale value to fallback to.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.AllowBackgroundDistributedCacheOperations
member.summary:
Even if the distributed cache is a secondary layer, by default every operation on it (get/set/remove/etc) is blocking: that is to say the FusionCache method call would not return until the inner distributed cache operation is completed.
This is to avoid rare edge cases like saving a value in the cache and immediately cheking the underlying distributed cache directly, not finding the value (because it is still being saved): very very rare, but still.
Setting this flag to true will execute most of these operations in the background, resulting in a performance boost.
TL/DR: set this flag to true for a perf boost, but watch out for rare side effects.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheEntryOptions.GetJitterDurationMs
member.summary: If is greater than , this method returns a randomized duration (in ms) between 0 and that will be added to the entry's specified . This is done to avoid a variation of the so called thundering herd problem that may happen when the entry for the same key expires on multiple nodes at the same time, because of high synchronization.
member.returns: An additional cache duration (in ms) to slightly vary the entry duration

member.param: The duration to set.
member.returns: The so that additional calls can be chained.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheOptions.DistributedCacheCircuitBreakerDuration
member.summary: The duration of the circuit-breaker used when working with the distributed cache. Defaults to , which means the circuit-breaker will never be activated.

member.summary: An optional prefix to prepend to any cache key passed to the cache methods.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheOptions.SerializationErrorsLogLevel

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheOptions.DistributedCacheSyntheticTimeoutsLogLevel
member.summary: Specify the to use when a synthetic timeout occurs during a distributed cache operation.

member.name: P:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.FusionCacheOptions.DistributedCacheErrorsLogLevel
member.summary: Specify the to use when any error (except for a synthetic timeout) occurs during a distributed cache operation.

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Internals.FusionCacheExecutionUtils.RunAsyncActionAdvancedAsync(System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Action{System.Exception},System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Run an async function with the ability to optionally set a timeout, await its completion (or run in a fire-and-forget way), process the eventually thrown exception or re-throw it.
member.param: The async action to execute.
The timeout to apply.
Indicates if the action should be cancelled in case of a timeout.
Indicates if the function's completion should be awaited or if the execution should be made in a fire-and-forget way.
An exception processor for the exception that may be thrown.
Indicates if, in case an exception is intercepted, it should be re-thrown.
An optional to cancel the operation.
member.returns: The resulting to await

member.name: M:ZiggyCreatures.FusionCaching.Internals.FusionCacheExecutionUtils.RunSyncActionAdvanced(System.Action{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Action{System.Exception},System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Run a sync action with the ability to optionally set a timeout, await its completion (or run in a fire-and-forget way), process the eventually thrown exception or re-throw it.
member.param: The sync action to execute.
The timeout to apply. Defaults to .
Indicates if the action should be cancelled in case of a timeout.
Indicates if the action's completion should be awaited or if the execution should be made in a fire-and-forget way.
An exception processor for the exception that may be thrown.
Indicates if, in case an exception is intercepted, it should be re-thrown.
An optional to cancel the operation.

member.summary: Represents one of the core pieces of an instance of an , dealing with acquiring and releasing locks in a highly optimized way.

member.summary: Acquire a generic lock, used to synchronize multiple factory operating on the same cache key, and return it.
member.param: The key for which to obtain a lock.
The operation id which uniquely identifies a high-level cache operation.
The optional timeout for the lock acquisition.
The to use, if any.
An optional to cancel the operation.
member.returns: The acquired genericlock object, later released when the crytical section is over.

The to use, if any.
